p: TNF- α and IL-6 are two essential proinflammatory cytokines in inflammation, and their high expressions are commonly found in liver injuries [ 27– 29]. In order to further clarify the anti-inflammatory effects of RTA and RTB, we detected the productions of these two proinflammatory cytokines in LPS-stimulated RAW264.7 and IL-6 in TNF- α-stimulated LO 2. The results are displayed in Figure 5. The productions of TNF- α and IL-6 in the medium supernatant after treatment with different concentrations of RTA or RTB were lower than those only treated with LPS in a dose-dependent manner proving that these two compounds could reduce the productions of critical proinflammatory cytokines.
